- The target apple is at (9,8), directly to the right.
- Moving RIGHT from (8,8) to (9,8) would reach the apple directly, with no immediate obstacles or threats.
- The path along the same row (y=8) is clear: (8,8) to (9,8).
- Moving UP or DOWN would be unnecessary detours and could risk collisions or complexity.
- Moving LEFT would turn us back toward our previous position at (7,8), potentially creating a loop or crashing into ourselves if not careful. Since the body is at [(7,8)] and the head is at (8,8), moving LEFT would take the snake into its own body (the body segment at (7,8)), which would be a collision.

- Continue to prioritize moving toward the closest apple directly whenever possible.
- Avoid risky moves like moving BACK or into potential obstacles.
- Plan to adjust if the apple moves or new threats appear.
